definitions.definition: In ancient Athens (and some other cities), the temporary banishment by popular vote of a citizen considered dangerous to the state .
Temporary exclusion from a community or society.

main_definition: ( historical ) In ancient Athens (and some other cities), the temporary banishment by popular vote of a citizen considered dangerous to the state . [from 16th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( figuratively ) Banishment by some general consent . [from 17th c.]
Temporary exclusion from a community or society.
